org.cryptacular.util

Class HashUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cryptacular.util.HashUtil

  • public final class HashUtil
extends Object
    Utility class for computing cryptographic hashes.
    Author:
    Marvin S. Addison

        public static byte[] hash(org.bouncycastle.crypto.Digest digest,
          byte[] data)
        Computes the hash of the given data using the given algorithm.
        Parameters:
        digest - Hash algorithm.
        data - Data to hash.
        Returns:
        Hash bytes that completely fill returned byte array.

      • hash

        public static byte[] hash(org.bouncycastle.crypto.Digest digest,
          byte[] data,
          int saltSize)
        Computes the salted hash of the given data using the given algorithm.
        Parameters:
        digest - Hash algorithm.
        data - Data to hash.
        saltSize - Number of bytes of random salt to append to digest.
        Returns:
        Hash bytes with appended salt that completely fill returned byte array.

      • hash

        public static byte[] hash(org.bouncycastle.crypto.Digest digest,
          byte[] data,
          byte[] salt,
          int iterations)
        Computes an iterated, salted hash of the given data using the given algorithm.
        Parameters:
        digest - Hash algorithm.
        data - Data to hash.
        salt - Salt to append to hash.
        iterations - Number of hash iterations to perform on input data.
        Returns:
        Hash bytes with appended salt that completely fill returned byte array.

      • hash

        public static byte[] hash(org.bouncycastle.crypto.Digest digest,
          InputStream input,
          byte[] salt,
          int iterations)
        Computes an iterated, salted hash of the given data using the given algorithm.
        Parameters:
        digest - Hash algorithm.
        input - Input stream containing data to hash.
        salt - Salt to append to hash.
        iterations - Number of hash iterations to perform on input data.
        Returns:
        Hash bytes with appended salt that completely fill returned byte array.

      • compareHash

        public static boolean compareHash(org.bouncycastle.crypto.Digest digest,
                  byte[] input,
                  byte[] hash)
        Determines whether the hash of the given input equals a known value.
        Parameters:
        digest - Hash algorithm.
        input - Data to hash.
        hash - Hash to compare with.
        Returns:
        True if the hash of the data under the given digest is equal to the hash, false otherwise.

      • compareHash

        public static boolean compareHash(org.bouncycastle.crypto.Digest digest,
                  InputStream input,
                  byte[] hash)
        Determines whether the hash of the given input equals a known value.
        Parameters:
        digest - Hash algorithm.
        input - Input stream containing data to hash.
        hash - Hash to compare with.
        Returns:
        True if the hash of the data under the given digest is equal to the hash, false otherwise.

      • compareSaltedHash

        public static boolean compareSaltedHash(org.bouncycastle.crypto.Digest digest,
                        byte[] input,
                        int iterations,
                        byte[] saltedHash)
        Determines whether the salted hash of the given input equals a known hash. The hash value is assumed to contain the salt appended to the hash output.
        Parameters:
        digest - Hash algorithm.
        input - Input to hash.
        iterations - Number of hash rounds.
        saltedHash - Hash to compare with of the form DIGEST+SALT, that is, where the salt is appended to the digest output bytes.
        Returns:
        True if the hash of the data under the given digest is equal to the hash, false otherwise.

      • compareSaltedHash

        public static boolean compareSaltedHash(org.bouncycastle.crypto.Digest digest,
                        InputStream input,
                        int iterations,
                        byte[] saltedHash)
        Determines whether the salted hash of the given input equals a known hash. The hash value is assumed to contain the salt appended to the hash output.
        Parameters:
        digest - Hash algorithm.
        input - Input stream containing data to hash.
        iterations - Number of hash rounds.
        saltedHash - Hash to compare with of the form DIGEST+SALT, that is, where the salt is appended to the digest output bytes.
        Returns:
        True if the hash of the data under the given digest is equal to the hash, false otherwise.
